intro: Arnica alpina var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf mountain arnica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It features upright stems that bear alternate, narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in the summer, which are typically arranged in a single terminal head. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. This variety is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
